dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so Kazakhstan's Prime Minister, Olzhas Bektenov, just approved a list of 475 state-involved businesses for privatization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so Kazakhstan's Prime Minister, Olzhas Bektenov, just approved a list of four hundred seventy five state-involved businesses for privatization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister of Kazakhstan Olzhas Bektenov chaired a meeting of the commission on economic demonopolization, according to the government's press service. "Following the meeting, a list of 475 state-involved business entities was approved for privatization, merger, or liquidation," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Four hundred seventy-five? That's a massive number. They're planning to either sell them off, merge them, or just shut them down entirely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Four hundred seventy-five? That's a massive number. They're planning to either sell them off, merge them, or just shut them down entirely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "Following the meeting, a list of 475 state-involved business entities was approved for privatization, merger, or liquidation," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and they're giving themselves until 2030 to get it all done. It's uh, part of this big economic liberalization push from the President.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and they're giving themselves until twenty thirty to get it all done. It's uh, part of this big economic liberalization push from the President.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The process will be carried out in stages and is expected to continue through 2030. Bektenov emphasized that the implementation of the Presidential decree "On Measures to Liberalize the Economy" must be completed within the designated timeframe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the decree on liberalizing the economy. But that's a huge timelineâ€”six years. I wonder how they'll phase it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the decree on liberalizing the economy. But that's a huge timeline-six years. I wonder how they'll phase it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they said more than half are already slated for action in 2025 and 2026, so the first big wave is coming pretty soon.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they said more than half are already slated for action in twenty twenty five and twenty twenty six, so the first big wave is coming pretty soon.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "More than half of the enterprises have been included in the action plan for 2025"2026," the government added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Deputy Prime Minister Serik Zhumangarin was there too, talking about reducing state participation across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Deputy Prime Minister Serik Zhumangarin was there too, talking about reducing state participation across the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Economy Serik Zhumangarin reported on ongoing efforts to reduce state participation in the economy and to increase the contribution of medium-sized businesses to GDP.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, except for what they're calling 'socially important and strategic sectors.' The state's gonna stay in those.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, except for what they're calling 'socially important and strategic sectors.' The state's gonna stay in those.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He noted that the state's involvement will be limited to socially important and strategic sectors only.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, you don't wanna privatize everything, like utilities or defense, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, you don't wanna privatize everything, like utilities or defense, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Marat Omarov from the Competition Agency was also there discussing removing market barriers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Marat Omarov from the Competition Agency was also there discussing removing market barriers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chairman of the Agency for Protection and Development of Competition Marat Omarov also outlined measures being taken to remove barriers that hinder market competition.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just about selling assets; it's about making the whole market more competitive afterward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's not just about selling assets; it's about making the whole market more competitive afterward.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. This feels like a really structured, long-term plan to shift the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. This feels like a really structured, long-term plan to shift the economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Let's see if they can actually stick to that 2030 deadline though. That's a lot of moving parts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Let's see if they can actually stick to that twenty thirty deadline though. That's a lot of moving parts.
